Return odds ratios (OR) from a PHS model at a specified age

get_or.Rd

get_or() calculates odds ratios from either a fitted PHS object (phsfit) or directly from a data.frame at a specified age. It returns a list containing the point estimate and optionally bootstrap confidence intervals.

Usage

get_or(object, or_age, ...)

# S3 method for class 'data.frame'
get_or(
  object,
  or_age,
  phs = "phs",
  age = "age",
  status = "status",
  numerator = c(0.8, 1),
  denominator = c(0, 0.2),
  bootstrap.iterations = NULL,
  conf.level = 0.95,
  ...
)

# S3 method for class 'phsfit'
get_or(
  object,
  or_age,
  numerator = c(0.8, 1),
  denominator = c(0, 0.2),
  bootstrap.iterations = NULL,
  conf.level = 0.95,
  ...
)

Arguments

object

An object for which an odds ratio is desired. Typically a data.frame or a phsfit object.

or_age

Integer specifying the age at which the odds ratio should be calculated.

...

Additional arguments (currently ignored)

phs

an optional string specifying the column name in data containing the polygenic hazard score for each subject. The default is "phs"

age

an optional string specifying the column name in data containing the age of each subject. For cases, this should be the age at event (e.g., diagnosis) and for controls this should be age of censoring (e.g., last observation). The default is "age"

status

an optional string specifying the column name in data containing case-control status (0 = censored, 1 = event). The default is "status"

numerator

Numeric vector of quantiles for the numerator (e.g., c(0.80, 1.0)).

denominator

Numeric vector of quantiles for the denominator (e.g., c(0.0, 0.2)).

bootstrap.iterations

Number of bootstrap iterations (used only in data.frame method).

conf.level

Confidence level for intervals (default 0.95).

Value

A list containing:

value

Point estimate of the OR

conf.low

Lower bound of confidence interval (if bootstrapped)

conf.high

Upper bound of confidence interval (if bootstrapped)

Examples

# Using a data.frame
OR <- get_or(test_data, or_age = 70, bootstrap.iterations = 300)

# Using a phsfit object
phsfit <- fit_phs(test_data, bootstrap.iterations = 300)
OR <- get_or(phsfit, or_age = 70)
